feed.title: Jason Crabtree‚Äôs Blog
feed.subtitle: A personal blog where I share my thoughts on design, technology, people and society. Customer Operations Operator, Hobbyist Designer, Coffee drinker and overthinker.

entry.title: Hello World
entry.content:
I‚Äôm so excited to welcome you to the first blog post published on my own domain.

Please come in, enjoy your stay ‚Äî have a look around.

I never really participated in the hey-day dominance of blogging. I don‚Äôt think my few posts on Medium quite count. So this will be a whole new experience.

This is a personal blog created in March 2019.

Future blog posts topics will include design, technology and long-form-thoughts on things I find interesting in humanties and society.

Warning: All future posts WILL be full of em dashes.

If you‚Äôd like to come along for the ride, I‚Äôd love it if you subscribed to my RSS feed or followed me on Twitter.

Thanks for visiting!
entry.summary: Welcome to the blogzone üëâ come on in...

entry.title: Apples
entry.content:
An apple is a sweet, edible fruit produced by an apple tree.

Apple trees are cultivated worldwide, and are the most widely grown species in the genus Malus. The tree originated in Central Asia, where its wild ancestor, Malus sieversii, is still found today. Apples have been grown for thousands of years in Asia and Europe, and were brought to North America by European colonists.
entry.summary: An apple is a sweet, edible fruit produced by an apple tree.

entry.title: Bananas
entry.content:
A banana is an edible fruit ‚Äì botanically a berry ‚Äì produced by several kinds of large herbaceous flowering plants in the genus Musa.

In some countries, bananas used for cooking may be called ‚Äúplantains‚Äù, distinguishing them from dessert bananas. The fruit is variable in size, color, and firmness, but is usually elongated and curved, with soft flesh rich in starch covered with a rind, which may be green, yellow, red, purple, or brown when ripe.
entry.summary: A banana is an edible fruit ‚Äì botanically a berry ‚Äì produced by several kinds of large herbaceous flowering plants in the genus Musa.

entry.title: Kia Ora, I’m Jason Crabtree
entry.content:
I solve problems for people and businesses. I do that thoughtfully, creatively and pragmatically. Recently I‚Äôve spent my days working in Customer Experience Design focused on cross-channel service design. At night, I‚Äôm learning to digital product design.

After five years working for New Zealand‚Äôs largest insurance company, I‚Äôve changed industries and continents. On January 29, 2019 I packed my life into a suitcase and moved to Dublin, Ireland.

I‚Äôm now on the hunt for new opportunities. My focus is working with a business-business software (SaaS) company solving meaningful problems for people and businesses. I believe helping people at work is a huge leverage point for helping to improve people‚Äôs lives.

I‚Äôm a team player, empathetic and good under pressure. I get stuff done and I‚Äôm a quick learner with knowledge in lots of different areas. I‚Äôd love to learn more about how we can work together ‚Äî and how I can help you and your business.
entry.summary: I solve problems for people and businesses. I do that thoughtfully, creatively and pragmatically. Recently I‚Äôve spent my days working in Customer Experience Design focused on cross-channel service design. At night, I‚Äôm learning to digital product design.

entry.title: Loving Kiwifruit
entry.content:
Kiwifruit (often abbreviated as kiwi), or Chinese gooseberry is the edible berry of several species of woody vines in the genus Actinidia.

The most common cultivar group of kiwifruit is oval, about the size of a large hen‚Äôs egg (5‚Äì8 cm (2.0‚Äì3.1 in) in length and 4.5‚Äì5.5 cm (1.8‚Äì2.2 in) in diameter).

It has a fibrous, dull greenish-brown skin and bright green or golden flesh with rows of tiny, black, edible seeds. The fruit has a soft texture, with a sweet and unique flavor.

This will be styled as a p tag with the css class fake-2
